Text.Language: For the sake of the many who desired to write about our service, O brother Theophilus, and the confirmation of the words that we know and were taught by the first ones who were servants of the Logos which I will teach you about; know and understand.

There was in the days of Herod, the king of Judea in the land of Syria (Sham), a certain priest named Zacharias, of the division of Abijah. His wife was of the daughters of Aaron, and her name was Elizabeth. They were both well advanced in years and were without children in their lives. Elizabeth was barren like Sarah at the time of Abraham, and they were both righteous before God, without fault, walking in His commandments.

So it was, that while he was serving as priest before God in the order of his division, according to the custom of the priesthood, his lot fell to burn incense when he went into the temple of the Lord. When he entered and stood on the altar, a shining angel appeared to him and stood on his right side. Zacharias was troubled, and fear fell upon him.

The angel said to him, â€œDo not be afraid, Zacharias, for your prayers and supplications were heard; and your wife Elizabeth will bear you a son, and you will have joy and gladness, and many will rejoice at his birth. He will be great in the sight of the Lord, and shall drink neither wine nor strong drink. He will also be filled with the Holy Spirit, even from his motherâ€™s womb. And he will turn many of the children of Israel to the Lord with his words.

He will make ready a people prepared for the Lord that will bring forth fruit worthy of life.â€? And Zacharias said to the angel who was speaking to him, â€œHow shall I know this? For I am an old man, and my wife is well advanced in years.â€?

The angel answered and said to him, â€œDo you not know me Zacharias? I am Gabriel, the angel of the Lord who stands in His presence. He sent me to speak to you and bring you these glad tidings that He taught me. Behold from now, you will be mute and not able to open your mouth or speak a word because you did not believe my words which will be fulfilled in their own time.â€?

Thus the elderâ€™s mouth was shut. The people waited for Zacharias, and marveled that he lingered so long in the temple. But when he came out, he could not speak to them; and they perceived that he had seen a vision in the temple, for he beckoned to them. And so it was, as soon as the days of his service were completed, that he was carried to his own house, mute for he has spoken back and did not obey.

Now after those days, the righteous Elizabeth conceived as the saying of the angel; and she hid herself five months, saying, â€œThus the Lord has dealt with me, in my advanced days, He looked on me, He had mercy on me, and took away the reproach among people.â€? Through the intercession of our Lady, the pure Virgin Mary, and the prayers of righteous priest Zacharias and Elizabeth, may the Lord grant us the forgiveness of our sins. Amen.

Now in the sixth month of the barren and old Elizabeth, the wife of Zacharias, Gabriel, the chosen one for the Annunciation and the angel of the Pantocrator who is pledge for this service was sent from the Lord to a city of Galilee named Nazareth, to a virgin betrothed to a man whose name was Joseph, of the house of David. The Virginâ€™s name who was betrothed to the faithful elder Joseph was Saint Mary. And having come in to her, the angel said announcing to her, â€œHail to you O full of grace, the Lord is with you.â€? The Virgin became troubled and considered his words and how can they be.

Then the angel answered, announcing to her the great mystery, saying, â€œDo not be afraid, O Mary the Queen, for you have found grace before the Lord God. Behold, you will conceive and give birth to a Son, and His name shall be called Jesus the Savior. He will be great in heaven and on earth, and will be called the Son of the Highest; and the Lord God will give Him the throne of His father David. And He will reign over the house of Jacob forever, and of His kingdom there will be no end.â€? Then Mary said to the angel, â€œHow can this be, since I am a virgin and do not know a man?â€?

O Christian people, hear Gabriel the true announcer. He was gentle in his words with the Virgin girl and said to her, â€œThe Holy Spirit will come upon you, and the power of the Highest will overshadow you; therefore, also, that Holy One who is to be born will be called the Son of the Highest. Do you not know Elizabeth whose days were completed while she was barren, she has also conceived despite her old age; and this is now the sixth month for her. For with God nothing will be impossible, no words without might and nothing will be contradicting.â€?

When the Virgin heard this, her heart became at rest and she answered with a kind heart and great joy saying, â€œBehold the maidservant of the Lord! Let it be to me according to your word with His will.â€? And the angel departed from her. The Virgin then thought in heart saying, â€œWho is he who have heard this command which the angel had informed me; that a virgin will be found pregnant without the seed of a man. And if I make this matter public, who will believe me especially the elder Joseph the Carpenter who they entrusted him with me. Because it never happened that a virgin shall conceive with words.

I have heard from the angel that my relative Elizabeth the barren one is with a child. Now I will rise and depart to her, greet her and serve her in her old age.â€? When the Virgin thought these matters, she prepared herself to depart to Elizabeth, the wife of Zacharias the priest.
